verses.roman:
tabe ta' ācārya saṅge lañā dui jane
karila icchāya bhojana, ye āchila mane

synonyms: tabe ta'-thereafter; ācārya—Advaita Ācārya; saṅge—with; lañā—taking; dui jane—the two persons, namely Mukunda and Haridāsa; karila—did; icchāya—according to desire; bhojana—eating; ye āchila mane—whatever there was in mind.
translation: Thereupon Advaita Ācārya took prasāda with Mukunda and Haridāsa, and they all wholeheartedly ate as much as they desired.
